name: BRONZE BUTLER
descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) is a cyber espionage group with likely Chinese origins that has been active since at least 2008. The group primarily targets Japanese organizations, particularly those in government, biotechnology, electronics manufacturing, and industrial chemistry.(Citation: Trend Micro Daserf Nov 2017)(Citation: Secureworks BRONZE BUTLER Oct 2017)(Citation: Trend Micro Tick November 2019)

subtechniques.name: Bypass User Account Control
subtechniques.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has used a Windows 10 specific tool and xxmm to bypass UAC for privilege escalation.(Citation: Secureworks BRONZE BUTLER Oct 2017)(Citation: Trend Micro Tick November 2019)

subtechniques.name: Domain Account
subtechniques.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has used net user /domain to identify account information.(Citation: Secureworks BRONZE BUTLER Oct 2017)

subtechniques.name: Web Protocols
subtechniques.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) malware has used HTTP for C2.(Citation: Secureworks BRONZE BUTLER Oct 2017)

subtechniques.name: Archive via Utility
subtechniques.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has compressed data into password-protected RAR archives prior to exfiltration.(Citation: Secureworks BRONZE BUTLER Oct 2017)(Citation: Trend Micro Tick November 2019)

subtechniques.name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
subtechniques.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has used a batch script that adds a Registry Run key to establish malware persistence.(Citation: Secureworks BRONZE BUTLER Oct 2017)

subtechniques.name: PowerShell
subtechniques.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has used PowerShell for execution.(Citation: Secureworks BRONZE BUTLER Oct 2017)

subtechniques.name: Windows Command Shell
subtechniques.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has used batch scripts and the command-line interface for execution.(Citation: Secureworks BRONZE BUTLER Oct 2017)

subtechniques.name: Visual Basic
subtechniques.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has used VBS and VBE scripts for execution.(Citation: Secureworks BRONZE BUTLER Oct 2017)(Citation: Trend Micro Tick November 2019)

subtechniques.name: Python
subtechniques.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has made use of Python-based remote access tools.(Citation: Trend Micro Tick November 2019)

subtechniques.name: Standard Encoding
subtechniques.descr: Several [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) tools encode data with base64 when posting it to a C2 server.(Citation: Secureworks BRONZE BUTLER Oct 2017)

technique_table_data.name: Data from Local System
technique_table_data.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has exfiltrated files stolen from local systems.(Citation: Secureworks BRONZE BUTLER Oct 2017)

technique_table_data.name: Data from Network Shared Drive
technique_table_data.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has exfiltrated files stolen from file shares.(Citation: Secureworks BRONZE BUTLER Oct 2017)

technique_table_data.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
technique_table_data.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) downloads encoded payloads and decodes them on the victim.(Citation: Secureworks BRONZE BUTLER Oct 2017)

technique_table_data.name: Drive-by Compromise
technique_table_data.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) compromised three Japanese websites using a Flash exploit to perform watering hole attacks.(Citation: Symantec Tick Apr 2016)

subtechniques.name: Symmetric Cryptography
subtechniques.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has used RC4 encryption (for Datper malware) and AES (for xxmm malware) to obfuscate HTTP traffic. [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has also used a tool called RarStar that encodes data with a custom XOR algorithm when posting it to a C2 server.(Citation: Secureworks BRONZE BUTLER Oct 2017)

technique_table_data.name: Exploitation for Client Execution
technique_table_data.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has exploited Microsoft Office vulnerabilities CVE-2014-4114, CVE-2018-0802, and CVE-2018-0798 for execution.(Citation: Symantec Tick Apr 2016)(Citation: Trend Micro Tick November 2019)

technique_table_data.name: File and Directory Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has collected a list of files from the victim and uploaded it to its C2 server, and then created a new list of specific files to steal.(Citation: Secureworks BRONZE BUTLER Oct 2017)

subtechniques.name: DLL
subtechniques.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has used legitimate applications to side-load malicious DLLs.(Citation: Trend Micro Tick November 2019)

subtechniques.name: Disable or Modify Tools
subtechniques.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has incorporated code into several tools that attempts to terminate anti-virus processes.(Citation: Trend Micro Tick November 2019)

subtechniques.name: File Deletion
subtechniques.descr: The [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) uploader or malware the uploader uses command to delete the RAR archives after they have been exfiltrated.(Citation: Secureworks BRONZE BUTLER Oct 2017)

technique_table_data.name: Ingress Tool Transfer
technique_table_data.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has used various tools to download files, including DGet (a similar tool to wget).(Citation: Secureworks BRONZE BUTLER Oct 2017)

technique_table_data.name: Masquerading

subtechniques.name: Right-to-Left Override
subtechniques.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has used Right-to-Left Override to deceive victims into executing several strains of malware.(Citation: Trend Micro Tick November 2019)

subtechniques.name: Match Legitimate Resource Name or Location
subtechniques.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has given malware the same name as an existing file on the file share server to cause users to unwittingly launch and install the malware on additional systems.(Citation: Secureworks BRONZE BUTLER Oct 2017)

technique_table_data.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has masked executables with document file icons including Word and Adobe PDF.(Citation: Trend Micro Tick November 2019)

subtechniques.name: Binary Padding
subtechniques.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) downloader code has included "0" characters at the end of the file to inflate the file size in a likely attempt to evade anti-virus detection.(Citation: Secureworks BRONZE BUTLER Oct 2017)(Citation: Trend Micro Tick November 2019)

subtechniques.name: Steganography
subtechniques.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has used steganography in multiple operations to conceal malicious payloads.(Citation: Trend Micro Tick November 2019)

subtechniques.name: Tool
subtechniques.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has obtained and used open-source tools such as [Mimikatz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0002), [gsecdump](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0008), and [Windows Credential Editor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0005).(Citation: Symantec Tick Apr 2016)

subtechniques.name: LSASS Memory
subtechniques.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has used various tools (such as Mimikatz and WCE) to perform credential dumping.(Citation: Secureworks BRONZE BUTLER Oct 2017)

subtechniques.name: Spearphishing Attachment
subtechniques.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) used spearphishing emails with malicious Microsoft Word attachments to infect victims.(Citation: Symantec Tick Apr 2016)(Citation: Trend Micro Tick November 2019)

technique_table_data.name: Remote System Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) typically use ping and [Net](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0039) to enumerate systems.(Citation: Secureworks BRONZE BUTLER Oct 2017)

subtechniques.name: At
subtechniques.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has used [at](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0110) to register a scheduled task to execute malware during lateral movement.(Citation: Secureworks BRONZE BUTLER Oct 2017)

subtechniques.name: Scheduled Task
subtechniques.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has used [schtasks](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0111) to register a scheduled task to execute malware during lateral movement.(Citation: Secureworks BRONZE BUTLER Oct 2017)

technique_table_data.name: Screen Capture
technique_table_data.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has used a tool to capture screenshots.(Citation: Secureworks BRONZE BUTLER Oct 2017)(Citation: Trend Micro Tick November 2019)

technique_table_data.name: Software Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has used tools to enumerate software installed on an infected host.(Citation: Trend Micro Tick November 2019)

technique_table_data.name: System Service Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has used TROJ_GETVERSION to discover system services.(Citation: Trend Micro Tick November 2019)

technique_table_data.name: System Time Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has used net time to check the local time on a target system.(Citation: Secureworks BRONZE BUTLER Oct 2017)

technique_table_data.name: Taint Shared Content
technique_table_data.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has placed malware on file shares and given it the same name as legitimate documents on the share.(Citation: Secureworks BRONZE BUTLER Oct 2017)

subtechniques.name: Pass the Ticket
subtechniques.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has created forged Kerberos Ticket Granting Ticket (TGT) and Ticket Granting Service (TGS) tickets to maintain administrative access.(Citation: Secureworks BRONZE BUTLER Oct 2017)

subtechniques.name: Malicious File
subtechniques.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has attempted to get users to launch malicious Microsoft Word attachments delivered via spearphishing emails.(Citation: Symantec Tick Apr 2016)(Citation: Trend Micro Tick November 2019)

subtechniques.name: Dead Drop Resolver
subtechniques.descr: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060)'s MSGET downloader uses a dead drop resolver to access malicious payloads.(Citation: Secureworks BRONZE BUTLER Oct 2017)

software_data.name: Daserf
software_data.descr: (Citation: Trend Micro Daserf Nov 2017)(Citation: Symantec Tick Apr 2016)

techniques.name: Masquerading
techniques.sub_name: Match Legitimate Resource Name or Location

software_data.name: gsecdump
software_data.descr: (Citation: Secureworks BRONZE BUTLER Oct 2017)(Citation: Symantec Tick Apr 2016)

software_data.name: Mimikatz
software_data.descr: (Citation: Secureworks BRONZE BUTLER Oct 2017)(Citation: Symantec Tick Apr 2016)(Citation: Trend Micro Tick November 2019)

software_data.name: Windows Credential Editor
software_data.descr: (Citation: Secureworks BRONZE BUTLER Oct 2017)(Citation: Symantec Tick Apr 2016)

alias_descriptions.name: REDBALDKNIGHT
alias_descriptions.descr: (Citation: Trend Micro Daserf Nov 2017)(Citation: Trend Micro Tick November 2019)

alias_descriptions.name: Tick
alias_descriptions.descr: (Citation: Trend Micro Daserf Nov 2017)(Citation: Symantec Tick Apr 2016)(Citation: Trend Micro Tick November 2019)

Trend Micro Daserf Nov 2017.description: Chen, J. and Hsieh, M. (2017, November 7). REDBALDKNIGHT/BRONZE BUTLER’s Daserf Backdoor Now Using Steganography. Retrieved December 27, 2017.

Secureworks BRONZE BUTLER Oct 2017.description: Counter Threat Unit Research Team. (2017, October 12). BRONZE BUTLER Targets Japanese Enterprises. Retrieved January 4, 2018.

Trend Micro Tick November 2019.description: Chen, J. et al. (2019, November). Operation ENDTRADE: TICK’s Multi-Stage Backdoors for Attacking Industries and Stealing Classified Data. Retrieved June 9, 2020.

Symantec Tick Apr 2016.description: DiMaggio, J. (2016, April 28). Tick cyberespionage group zeros in on Japan. Retrieved July 16, 2018.

Recorded Future RedEcho Feb 2021.description: Insikt Group. (2021, February 28). China-Linked Group RedEcho Targets the Indian Power Sector Amid Heightened Border Tensions. Retrieved March 22, 2021.
